answers.answer: My what to expect book says pregnancy can cause thyroid issues that require monitoring. Just like pregnancy can cause hypertension or diabetes it can also mess with your thyroid. They are probably ruling out a tumor on your thyroid that would be a reason for your high levels. Try not to worry til you know it could be not a big deal at all. Actually my friend had thyroid cancer while.pregnant and she had all healthy pregnancy and they removed the cancer and all is well.

question: So my first appt ever my doctor did blood work and stuff. Well i went in a week and a half later bc i had a little UTI. She told me then that my thyroid level was high but she went to check again and said it was fine. Well anyway the other day i postes about my doctor not wanting to do a u/s till 18 weeks.Well when i went to see her the other day they went and tested me again. My nurse just called me 15 min ago and said the doctor had her call me bc my thyroid level was 2 times higher. So she wants to do A u/s on my throat asap bc shes really concerned.I ended up  switching docs but then switched back to her confusing i know but my husband and i agreed. Anyway whats this mean and has any of you ladies had this!?
title: ladies i really am concered. sorry for posting again.
